alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 2:17AM EDT until August 24 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Monroe County in southeastern Michigan... Western Wayne County in southeastern Michigan... Southeastern Washtenaw County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 315 AM EDT. * At 216 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Carleton, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Flat Rock around 220 AM EDT. Carleton around 230 AM EDT. Monroe around 245 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Newport, Whittaker, Gibraltar, Erie, New Boston, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Bolles Harbor, Rockwood and Westland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
